definition: end (of a performance or sports match)/last round of testing in the imperial examinations
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
the final bell (esp. in sports competition)

sentences.english: The score was five- nil with five minute left in the game.
sentences.chinese: 比賽離終場還有五分鐘時，雙方比分爲五比零。
薩瑟蘭1962年《夢遊女》終場錄音室錄音。

sentences.english: The deciding moment came five minutes from time when Derlei found the net.
sentences.chinese: 決定性的時刻在終場前五分鐘來臨。

sentences.english: And 19 minutes from the end, Anderson made it 3-1.
sentences.chinese: 終場前19分鐘，安德森把比分改寫爲3比1。

sentences.english: And the mutual love-in continued after the final whistle.
sentences.chinese: 在終場哨響之後，這種彼此之間的愛與懷念仍在繼續。

sentences.english: By the time the final whistle sounded, Gary Neville and Wes Brown had joined the walking wounded.
sentences.chinese: 而終場哨吹響的時候內維爾和布朗也掛了。

sentences.english: Here the squalid tragedy was played out .
sentences.chinese: 這出拙劣的悲劇在這裏一直演到終場。
